message: i guess i'm not really one for conferences anyway
http://codeconf.com/
Who's going?
not I
too far, 2x the pycon price for a fraction of the awesome
@alex You don't know if it'll be a fraction of the awesome yet.
true, fewer speakers (who I recognize), no summits, no sprints though
The only ones I recognize are Jacob, Ryan, and Coda
is that not a plus
@markpasc not knowing any of the speakers?  eh, maybe if they came with extensive bios of awesome, but I haven't heard of them and bios don't get me excited
yeah
it's going on during my birthday. i think that means @ericflo is buying me a ticket!
@rentzsch put on the C4 conference for mac developers in chicago
and i've been following @ginatrapani's work on that tweet answer tracker app
http://thinkupapp.com/
stubbornella is one of the luminaries of the programmer-leaning HTML/CSS/JS folks.
and gina trappini did lifehacker, some firefox extensions, and todo.txt
At least the site looks nice, right? Right? ;D
something for everybody, i guess
@bryan Oh yeah, it's a classy conference site
... or at least that's the case for the majority of the things I do.
meh, i wasn't impressed with @stubbornella in the css summit last summer
lots of "don't you dare make your css semantic" junk
really? I thought her thing was the exact opposite.
granted, she was speaking solely about speed, but most of us aren't at facebook-scale :)
Last I heard, she was doing "object oriented css" which translates into making css classes which act as mixins to achieve functionality
yeah, but the "mixins" she described were along the lines of "tiny text next to image" and whanot
nothing about the actual meaning of the content, classes are designed solely for presentation
which seems ... icky to me
*shrug*
but, that's just me :)
I've long since realized that you'll never do a redesign without altering the HTML so mandating that class names can't influence presentation is a farce.
Right. I agree with her reasoning.
but anyway, it's limited to 300 attendees, so there's no point even wondering if i'm going
its so you can give a name to "that thing that the author module looks like"
oh, i'm not mandating that they can't influence presentation
but i still like using class="author" but that's precisely the kind of thing she advocated against
*shrug*
ie: the actual meaning of class='author' isn't to impart any meaning to basically anyone.
